CatDescriptText: Richard Newman, rubbish collector, Beltzhoover and Janet Kratochwill, office worker, Wilkinsburg, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 1, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that the military strength for defense of the United States is adequate enough like Presidential candidate Richard Nixon declares it is, or do you believe that it is not strong enough, and needs strengthening, like Presidential candidate John Kennedy says it is?"  Mr. Newman's answer reads: "I don't think we are strong enough, because there is so much going on in the world today..."  Mrs. Kratochwill's answer reads: "I believe what Nixon says."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Richard Newman wearing suspenders and cap, standing on sidewalk at intersection of Smithfield Street and Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Janet Kratochwill wearing sunglasses, holding rectangular handbag, standing with arms crossed on Smithfield Street, Downtown
